Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: lip glazed; in reserved handle zone, black-figure decoration consisting of panther (body, added red neck, and head remaining) to right; inscription on exterior.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 409-10, no. B624)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 709, no. 672, pl. 26.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0502) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
